sentence-with-footnote: by Richard Cyganiak and Anja Jentzsch. http://lod-cloud.net/"
column5: "It was one of the first Linked Open Data datasets available in 2007 and is a hub in the Linked Open Data cloud******."

sentence-with-footnote: "The latest DBpedia release provides data for 4.0 million entities out of which 3.2 millions are classified according to the DBpedia ontology.******"
"DBpedia Lookup****** is an additional service which allows to search for DBpedia entities using either strings or prefixes (for auto-completion)."
"The DBpedia mappings wiki****** is an effort to crowdsource the mappings between the Wikipedia infoboxes and the DBpedia ontology."
"DBpedia Viewer is provided as open source on Github******."
"We use the Open Source edition of the Virtuoso server****** as our triple store."

column6: an opensource JavaScript framework that implements the Model View Controller (MVC) paradigm for web applications."

column5: we used the CSS from Twitter Bootstrap******."

sentence-with-footnote: "The Marbles Linked Data browser ****** is a server-side application that generates HTML from Semantic Web content using Fresnel [10] vocabularies."
"Pubby ****** is a server-side Java application that can be configured to use a SPARQL endpoint and publish the data behind it as Linked Data."
"The Graphity project ****** provides a framework for publishing RDF data or building applications around it."
"We would like to thank Google for sponsoring this work through the Google Summer of Code 2013 project.******"
